title: CBSL extends suspension on Perpetual Treasuries
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has decided to extend the suspension of Perpetual Treasuries Limited (PTL) from carrying on the business and activities of a Primary Dealer for a further period of six months.

title: Trump complains that US flags will be half-staff on his inauguration day
byline: President-elect Donald Trump complained on Friday that American flags would still be lowered to half-staff in honor of the late President Jimmy Carter during Trump’s Jan. 20 inauguration.

title: PM Harini denies involvement in cancelling lecture at Peradeniya Uni.
byline: The Office of the Prime Minister and Minister of Education, Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, has categorically denied any involvement in the cancellation of the scheduled lecture organized by the International Youth and Students for Social Equality (IYSSE) at Peradeniya University.

title: Paddy farmers face new crisis as unidentified worm species devastate crops
byline: Sri Lanka’s paddy farmers, already reeling from a series of crises, including recent heavy rainfall and wildlife intrusions, are now grappling with a new and alarming threat—an outbreak of an unidentified species of worms devastating their crops.

title: Sacred rituals halted at ‘Sabaragamuwa Saman Devalaya’ amid protests against Acting Basnayake Nilame
byline: The board of duty of the ‘Sabaragamuwa Maha Saman Devalaya’ has launched a strike by withdrawing from sacred pooja and rituals of the devalaya today (05), citing their objection to the appointment of an acting Basnayake Nilame, which they allege violates long-standing traditions and was influenced by political considerations.

title: Showers expected in parts of the country
byline: The Department of Meteorology showers may occur at a few places in Eastern province and in Mullaittivu district.

title: Heaviest snowfall in a decade is possible as wintry blast roils parts of US
byline: A blast of snow, ice, wind and plunging temperatures stirred up dangerous travel conditions in parts of the central U.S. on Sunday, as a disruptive winter storm brought the possibility of the heaviest snowfall in a decade to some areas.

title: Special investigation into land allocations since 2015
byline: Deputy Minister of Land and Irrigation, Dr Susil Ranasinghe, has stated that steps have been taken to launch a special place investigation into lands allocated for various purposes since 2015.

title: 41 cases of Rat Fever reported in Vavuniya in 2024
byline: The Office of the Regional Director of Health Services (RDHS) in Vavuniya has reported that 41 people in the district contracted Leptospirosis, also known as “rat fever,” in 2024.

title: NTC to prepare list of passenger rights to ensure safety in buses
byline: The National Transport Commission (NTC) has announced that preparations have begun to compile a list of passenger rights to ensure the safety of passengers traveling on buses.

title: Cardinal Ranjith urges new Constitution to strengthen democracy
byline: The Archbishop of Colombo, His Eminence Malcolm Cardinal Ranjith, has stated that a new constitution is essential for ensuring democratic governance.

title: Ex-Minister Manusha Nanayakkara’s brother remanded further
byline: The brother of former Foreign Employment Minister Manusha Nanayakkara has been ordered to be remanded further until January 11, 2025, after being produced before the Gampaha Magistrate’s Court.

title: Term test question paper ‘leaked’ in NCP; Exam suspended
byline: The Sinhala Literature question paper for the Grade 11 term test in the North Central Province (NCP) has been confirmed to have leaked on social media, prompting authorities to take immediate action.

title: Sri Lanka Navy seized narcotics valued nearly Rs. 3,000M during operations in 2024
byline: Sri Lanka Navy’s operations in 2024 have yielded impressive results, bringing to justice 407 persons, both local and foreign, involved in a wide array of illegal acts such as smuggling of narcotics, prescription drugs, and contraband as well as apprehending those involved in human smuggling.

title: No direct talks with foreign missions: New circular tightens Sri Lanka’s diplomatic protocols
byline: The government has introduced a comprehensive set of guidelines aimed at streamlining and ensuring coordinated communication between the state institutions and foreign entities.

title: India detects first suspected HMPV case, 8-month-old baby infected
byline: India has detected its first suspected Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) case in Bengaluru in an eight-month old baby.

title: ‘The Brutalist,’ ‘Emilia Perez’ triumph at Golden Globes
byline: Two wildly audacious films — Brady Corbet’s 215-minute postwar epic “The Brutalist” and Jacques Audiard’s Spanish language, genre-shifting trans musical “Emilia Perez” — won top honors at the 82nd Golden Globes on Sunday.

title: Seven CCTV cameras go missing from old Police Headquarters
byline: Seven CCTV cameras installed at the old Police Headquarters in Colombo Fort have been reported missing.

title: Two including ex-provincial councilor further remanded
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has ordered the two individuals including former member of Western Provincial Council Salochana Gamage, who were arrested while accepting a bribe, to be further remanded in custody until January 17, 2025.

title: Parliament of Sri Lanka clarifies increased tea reception costs for inaugural session
byline: The Parliament of Sri Lanka has issued a clarification regarding a recent media report claiming the “actual expenses of the tea receptions” held after the inaugural session of the Tenth Parliament.

title: New chairman and board members appointed to 1990 ‘Suwa Seriya’ Foundation
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has appointed a new Chairman and Board Members to the 1990 ‘Suwa Seriya’ Foundation.

title: New Chairman appointed to Official Languages Commission
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has appointed Nimal R. Ranawake as the new Chairman of the Official Languages Commission of Sri Lanka.

title: Cricket legend Jonty Rhodes explores Sri Lanka on Tuk-Tuk: Praises local culture and tourism
byline: South Africa’s cricket legend and fielding maestro, Jonty Rhodes, has recently embarked on a unique adventure across Sri Lanka, exploring the island nation in a tuk-tuk.

title: CTU Secretary Stalin and 33 others freed from quarantine rules violation case
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has ordered the release of 34 individuals including the Secretary of the Ceylon Teachers’ Union (CTU) Joseph Stalin from a case filed over staging protest violating quarantine rules in 2021.

title: Another train derails disrupting services on up-country line
byline: A mixed train traveling from Badulla to Kandy has derailed in the Demodara area this afternoon (06).

title: Additional trains in operation for upcoming long weekends
byline: Sri Lanka Railways says additional trains will be deployed in the months of January and February in order to reduce congestion in the upcoming long weekends.

title: India to offer unconditional support for Sri Lanka’s sports development
byline: Indian High Commissioner to Sri Lanka Santosh Jha has expressed India’s commitment to offer unconditional support for the development of sports in Sri Lanka.

title: Traffic DIG clarifies modifications permitted for three-wheelers
byline: Sri Lanka Police reiterated that modifications and decorations to three-wheelers are only permitted if they adhere to the guidelines approved by the Department of Motor Traffic.

title: Elon Musk’s Starlink to launch on United Airlines flights by spring
byline: United Airlines flights will have access to Elon Musk’s Starlink Wi-Fi services as early as this spring, a sign of the widening reach of the tech billionaire.

title: Colombo Stock Exchange declines for second consecutive day
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) recorded a decline for the second straight day today (06), reflecting a slowdown after a historic rally.

title: President and Attorney General discuss on controversial legal proceedings
byline: President Anura Kumara Disanayake has held a discussion with the Attorney General and officials from the Attorney General’s Department at the Presidential Secretariat today (06).

title: Syrian caretaker government to hike public sector salaries by 400% next month
byline: Syria’s finance minister said on Sunday the government would hike salaries for many public sector employees by 400% next month after completing an administrative restructuring of ministries to boost efficiency and accountability.

title: HMPV cases surge in Malaysia, India and Hong Kong: Is it a new disease?
byline: The HMPV cases are now reportedly rising in Malaysia. In 2024, 327 HMPV cases were reported in the country, a 45% increase compared to 225 cases in 2023. This increase comes amidst reports of rising respiratory illnesses in other countries, including China.

title: Grade 11 Term Tests suspended in NCP schools
byline: The Grade 11 Term Tests in all government schools within the North-Central Province have been cancelled until further notice.

title: Canada PM Trudeau is likely to announce resignation, source says
byline: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau is increasingly likely to announce he intends to step down, though he has not made a final decision, a source familiar with Trudeau’s thinking said on Sunday.

title: Govt. to commence paddy purchasing this month
byline: The government has announced its plan to commence the purchasing of paddy from the third week of January.

title: Canada’s Prime Minister Justin Trudeau resigns
byline: Under growing pressure from his own party, Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has announced he will step down and end his nine-year stretch as leader.
